notesStmt.note: Some of the quires are incomplete. Partly worm-eaten. Stained.

Folios 2r and 98v contain doodles.Folios 1r-1v belong to a different manuscript (vellum). Yehudah Ha-Kohen Ashkenazi: inscribed, folio 1r, 3r. Shemu᾿el Casani (?): inscribed in a note of sale, folio 1r.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Contains Novellae on the tractate Ḳidushin.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental semi-cursive script of the 15th century, badly written in parts.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine title: 'Chiddushim 'al Kiddushin. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 27,130.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 237: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153: inscribed, folio [90v].
